Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as dc456f9bbd7df077679656c75ab2f1155dee95a3 by Vivekanand Veeracholan
Can you add this multiple UART support to the base bb in meta-phosphor instead? That way it can be used by other machines if necessary
It platform depends on the current setting, if you want to push to the meta-phosphor, it needs to modify to a more general one.

Yes, please generalize this so it can be reused if necessary.

That's lower priority compared to the other basic platform support in this chain though
whitespace errors, here and throughout the file
Done

The console server should be started from the service. 
The only extra step this script does is setup the UART MUX and that should be done as ExecStartPre in the service. 

Using the script for console server will lead to failure in services that depends on this. The console server will be starting late as the mux script runs first but the obmc-console-client services might start immediately after this service and will fail.

Add the mux execution to ExecStartPre and the console server to the ExecStart in the obmc-console@.service.
Like

"ExecStartPre=/usr/sbin/kudo_uart_mux_ctrl.sh %i
ExecStart=/usr/sbin/obmc-console-server --config /etc/obmc-console/server.%i.conf %i"
Done

Don't need local-tty configuration. 
Also some services for host console might use the default socket. So remove the socket-id for this conf.
For the server.ttyS3.conf, keep the socket id as that is for scp.
Done

Tabs to spaces.
Add kudo overrides to all the variables
Done
Trailing whitespace
Done
use append_kudo.
Done
Remove the ssh parts in the commit since that is removed.
Done
"i" is missing at the end of your name.
Done
this is no longer needed as the ssh mode is not enabled anymore.
Done
Remove the socket ID for this (ttyS1) alone. host console clients sometimes use default socket id.
Done
use kudo override. same for line 7, and SRC_URIs.
Done
update this to reflect just the console part. No ssh
Done
No more ssh ports. remove this line
Done

To remove these it is just SYSTEMD_SUBSTITUTIONS_remove_kudo.
the override has both remove and append.
Done
use append_kudo (and space before content) instead of +=
Done
